title: Between 1 January 2019 and 31 December 2019, will an armed group from Bangladesh engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Bangladesh?
preds: Repression tactics reportedly used upon opposition party leaders, supporters. https://www.voanews.com/a/bangladesh-police-accused-of-harassment-with-fake-cases/4827043.html

The most recent crisis in Bangladesh is with the new elections of the new president. The elections were not seen as especially free and fair as there has been accounts of ballot rigging. There is also a riot going on due to the workers wages but that has been a continuous problem within Bangladesh.

Affirming, for now. Currently finding little available info. about general status of groups disputing the recent national election. https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-bangladesh-election-observers-exclusi/exclusive-some-in-bangladesh-election-observer-group-say-they-now-regret-involvement-idUKKCN1PG0MN https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/bangladesh-government-rejects-report-claiming-irregularities-in-elections-1978129
Unlikely, because there is little outside interest, i.e. other country provocateurs, to incite Bangladeshi's to commit violence.
A stable government in Bangladesh, election year in India and accelerated sustainable development indicators is in favor of a decreased armed conflicts resulting in civilian casualties.
Represseion often brings hightened violence from the bosses.

A "campaign" of "systematic killing" of 1000+ civilians seems unlikely, but Bangladesh currently features a repressive regime (https://foreignpolicy.com/2019/01/07/the-world-should-be-watching-bangladeshs-election-debacle-sheikh-hasina/), and restive groups within its population (https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2019-01-09/bangladesh-clashes-prompt-garment-industry-wage-review).
Early Warning base rate is 8.8% No recent mention on Genocide Watch. ACLED civilian data is low double digits per month.

No word of 'armed groups' or 'systematic killing'...but one article describes (alleged) "post-election violence" in (parts of) Bangladesh: https://en.prothomalo.com/bangladesh/news/189075/%E2%80%98AL-indulges-in-post-polls-violence%E2%80%99

(Initial forecast:) Unlikely, but not impossible. Obtaining accurate, timely reporting of 'systematic' killings could be difficult. (Recent events:) https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bangladesh-election/bangladeshs-violent-vote-campaigning-ends-ahead-of-weekend-poll-idUSKCN1OR04P https://www.yahoo.com/news/security-tight-dhaka-bangladesh-prepares-vote-110843359.html
